name: TheAtlantic
text: "In the course of failing to usurp the presidency ... Trump succeeded at usurping the Republican Party. On that front, his accomplishments since November 3 have been impressive," @jon_rauch writes: https://t.co/1SRfvIKvQW

name: TheAtlantic
text: More than most, four men shaped the oft-cited “strategic tensions” over the world’s most important body of water. @DanielYergin writes of the ghosts who haunt the South China Sea: https://t.co/GZoKObSlpe

name: TheAtlantic
text: Facebook isn’t just having a bad week, or month, or year, or decade. It’s doing exactly what it was built for, @AdrienneLaF writes. https://t.co/7i9RwPg0C7

name: TheAtlantic
text: “When you find yourself being flattered and asked for your debit-card number in the same breath,” @amandamull writes, “it’s time once again to ponder one of life’s most important questions: What’s the catch?” https://t.co/BbBu4k1hoy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Texas politician has built his career on using ... defeats to rally support. And losing this lawsuit—his highest-profile setback to date—might have been just what he needed as his own legal problems continue to mount," @CarlosASanchez writes: https://t.co/r861FnLZAK

name: TheAtlantic
text: The year 2020 has given more to the authors of history textbooks than it has to the writers of diaries. @jpinsk chronicles the year we lost: https://t.co/mexWN0h7Tm

name: TheAtlantic
text: “To meet with the prophet during a plague, certain protocols must be followed.” After traveling to Utah to interview the president of the Mormon Church, @mckaycoppins considers the future of a uniquely American faith. https://t.co/XGo2rhxuZc

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: This year, Americans have depleted inventories of everything from flour to dumbbells to sofas in pursuit of comfort and novelty. Now they’re on to Christmas trees, which are selling faster than ever before. I wrote about the pandemic Christmas tree rush. https://t.co/gKrIv3iRxL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Since the start of the pandemic, Americans have looked to everything from baking projects to jigsaw puzzles to soothe their frayed nerves. Their latest target: Christmas trees, which are selling at a historic clip, writes @amandamull. https://t.co/VlJFNxWB68

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @mckaycoppins: Two hundred years ago, a purported opening of the heavens in upstate New York launched one of the most peculiar and enduring religious movements in American history—one that I belong to. 

On faith, identity, and what the Mormon story says about America: https://t.co/u9LSR7JSTO

name: TheAtlantic
text: Facebook is operating at megascale, @AdrienneLaF argues, and that is what makes it so dangerous. Read more in the latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/xbKd3o6G5W

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The empty bowling alleys and movie theaters; the infinity buffet of entertainment and partisan media; the dissolution of a shared American reality—these are distinct yet connected phenomena," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/qsULblKn1M

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Volcanoes are so outrageously cool. https://t.co/btk9MAxAKV

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @elainejgodfrey: NEW: I wrote about progressives in Georgia, a new round of COVID relief checks, and a different kind of suburban voter. 

https://t.co/3nzqaZF9ld

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: Day 15 of the Hubble advent calendar: I don't know what's going on here but I love every pixel https://t.co/ncW6cxSof5 https://t.co/KhFN2mnAmu

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: In which @skornhaber interprets the Taylor Swift lyric “Lost in your current like a priceless wine" to devastating effect: https://t.co/aBORVA8P9y https://t.co/8s5gewjBIy

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: 2020: The Year in Volcanic Activity. Out of an estimated 1,500 active volcanoes, about 50 erupt every year. Included in this year's roundup are Taal volcano in the Philippines, La Cumbre in the Galapagos, Mount Shishaldin in Alaska, and more. https://t.co/mHZTf1Quse https://t.co/KTIsyBbXlH

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "Reading a le Carré novel often feels more revelatory about England, and the world, than any op-ed." https://t.co/nhhdOI2A1x

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: “I don’t think you can separate the good things we do from the doctrine,” the president of the LDS Church tells @mckaycoppins. “It’s not what we do; it’s why we do it.” 

This reflection on Mormonism, on its 200th anniversary, is worth your time: https://t.co/Nd1pKsei0h

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: I spoke with Scott Kirby, the CEO of @United, about the airline’s plan to reach net zero by using carbon removal.

$UAL
https://t.co/tVZXiQzJyh

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JohnGHendy: This new @mckaycoppins feature is layered, nuanced, and searching. 

It contains some important passages, like this one, about what it's like to be even remotely different at work or school https://t.co/NeW5mgsaQ9 https://t.co/WTvVaIeIUN

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: "This is not a foreign issue. It is an issue related with my language; it is an issue related with my culture; it is an issue related with my tradition."

Really interesting piece by @TMclaughlin3 https://t.co/FsswSvyJTr

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Do we need shared office spaces? How do you strike a work-life balance when you work from home? The Atlantic's collection "How We Work" considers the ever-evolving role of office culture and the future of work. Presented by @Webex. https://t.co/Jx7aJqvylE

name: TheAtlantic
text: What's the best way to reduce the climate change impact of flying? @yayitsrob thinks through the options and examines United's plan in this week's Planet Weekly newsletter. https://t.co/Ea8HP5x1sT

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: While many adult learners have had to prioritize earning over education during the pandemic, these McDonald's employees have stayed on track. Here's how. https://t.co/4otBRdeT0U @McDonaldsCorp https://t.co/TNmWelmZQ8

name: TheAtlantic
text: BTS, Taylor Swift, Lil Uzi Vert, and more. @skornhaber, Hannah Giorgis, James Parker, and @lenikacruz pick the best albums of 2020: https://t.co/5xxZ8brUBI
